steps.title: Rinse the Rice
steps.description: Wash the seeraga samba rice under running water 2–3 times until the water runs clear.

steps.title: Soak the Rice
steps.description: Soak the washed rice in water for 20–30 minutes. This helps it cook evenly and absorb flavors better.

steps.title: Prepare Marinade
steps.description: In a bowl, mix curd, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, black pepper powder, and salt.

steps.title: Marinate the Meat
steps.description: Add the mutton or chicken to the marinade and coat well. Let it rest for 30 minutes to 1 hour.

steps.title: Heat the Oil and Ghee
steps.description: In a heavy-bottomed pot, heat the oil and optional ghee over medium heat.

steps.title: Fry Whole Spices
steps.description: Add fennel seeds, cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and star anise. Fry until aromatic (about 30 seconds).

steps.title: Sauté the Onions
steps.description: Add the sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown, stirring occasionally.

steps.title: Add Ginger-Garlic Paste and Chilies
steps.description: Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Cook until the raw smell disappears (around 2–3 minutes).

steps.title: Cook the Tomatoes
steps.description: Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate from the mixture.

steps.title: Add Fresh Herbs
steps.description: Mix in mint leaves and coriander leaves. Cook for another 1–2 minutes until wilted and fragrant.

steps.title: Add Marinated Meat
steps.description: Transfer the marinated meat into the pot. Stir well to combine with the masala base.

steps.title: Cook the Meat
steps.description: Cook the meat on medium heat until it's partially cooked and the masala is thick and clings to the meat.

steps.title: Pour Water
steps.description: Add 3 1/2 cups of water to the pot. Stir and bring it to a boil over high heat.

steps.title: Season the Water
steps.description: Taste and adjust salt as needed. The water should taste slightly salty at this stage.

steps.title: Simmer the Meat
steps.description: Reduce the heat and simmer the meat for 5–10 minutes until it becomes tender.

steps.title: Drain and Add Rice
steps.description: Drain the soaked rice completely and gently add it to the pot with the meat and broth.

steps.title: Mix Gently
steps.description: Stir the rice gently into the liquid, taking care not to break the grains.

steps.title: Cook on Dum
steps.description: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat for 15–20 minutes until the rice is fully cooked and the water is absorbed.

steps.title: Rest the Biryani
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest, covered, for 10 minutes to allow flavors to settle.

steps.title: Add Lemon Juice
steps.description: Drizzle lemon juice over the cooked biryani. Gently fluff the rice to mix without breaking it.

steps.title: Serve
steps.description: Serve hot with onion raita or brinjal gravy. Enjoy the distinct, spicy-tangy flavors of Dindigul biryani.
